Pre-Game Insights: Mexico are firm favorites to win this fixture in California against a side they have not faced since a 2-1 victory back in the FIFA Confederations Cup of 2017.

Mexico and Aguirre will be eager to get the fans back onside after a difficult Copa America, so expect them to come out with a point to prove in front of what is likely to be a lively crowd in California.
Miscellaneous Highlights: In five previous meetings with New Zealand, only once were the team from Oceania able to score more than one goal, and that was at the end of a playoff tie for the 2014 World Cup that Mexico had already effectively won.
The All Whites have also managed to score more than one goal in just one of their past 15 international games.
Others: Santiago Gimenez to score two or more goals
